alert.note: Alert for Raft River Region; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains; Sun Valley Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 05 at 2:26PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Winter Storm will provide light to moderate snow and wind Tonight and Thursday... The next incoming storm arrives tonight in the Albion Range of mountains, the Raft River area, and the Ketchum-Sun Valley part of the Wood River. This includes the towns of Albion, Almo, Malta, Rockland, Holbrook, and city of Ketchum. Snowfall amounts for tonight through Thursday afternoon will range from 0.5 of one inch to 6 inches of snow. The heavier end of the range will occur at elevations of 7000 feet and higher. This includes Galena Summit in Blaine County. Below 7000 feet elevation, expect rain to mix with the snow, not allowing much of the snow to stick. Wind is currently strong at 20 to 30 mph. This will subside slightly during the evening hours tonight, but then increase again as the next storm arrives after midnight, returning to the 20 to 30 mph range.
